column4: can anyone please tell me how to do a search from command line to find a trash icon in ubuntu. i would think it would have "trash" and either "svg" or "png" in it. I tried sudo find /usr/ -name "trash*png" but that didn't work. any thoughts?
that didn't find anything. I am using cairo-dock from ppa weekly. i am missing alamixer icon, trash icon, and clock icon for some reaason.
this should give you some clues to where icons are located: http://tuxenclave.wordpress.com/2007/11/23/ubuntu-customization-guide-v2/
